result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donnie J Harris Sr

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM; Case called for hearing.  Defendant Donnie J Harris Sr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter was set for 2:30 p.m. and inquires if there are any objections to calling the matter early.  State notes there are no victim rights issues so there is no objection to the matter being called early.  Court inquires if the defendant has been to the Public Defender's office yet to see if he qualifies for representation.  Defendant advises he has not.  Court will provide the defendant with the information sheet for the Public Defender's office and advises him to report there after court today to be evaluated.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings/status of counsel in about 30-45 days.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released.

2:21 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Donnie J Harris Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Donnie J Harris Sr. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation at this time, unless he loses his employment and would need to be reevaluated.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Donnie J Harris Sr
Current: 5250 N 91st St.  Apt. 3, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: 3732 N 19Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
